{"step_by_step_thinking": "The atypical or unique tooth is the one that has a structure different from the rest. In the primary dentition, the lower first molar is the most unique because it does not resemble any other tooth in the mouth. It has a unique shape and size, and its occlusal surface is characterized by a prominent mesiobuccal cusp and a smaller distobuccal cusp.", "answer_choice": "A"}
